snippet: On Monday, a four-hour firefight at the airport left only the suicide bombers dead, and a police officer was killed in an attack of the provincial council building on Monday.
abstract: Afghan insurgents send 13 suicide bombers to assault two high-profile government targets, one in Kabul and the other in a southern province; attacks, which left the suicide bombers and one police officer dead, are seen as striking proof of the insurgency's willingness to expend followers on missions that have relatively little military impact but command headlines.

byline.original: By ALISSA J. RUBIN and SHARIFULLAH SAHAK
byline.contributor: Taimoor Shah contributed reporting from Kandahar, Afghanistan.

lead_paragraph: On Monday, a four-hour firefight at the airport left only the suicide bombers dead, and a police officer was killed in an attack of the provincial council building on Monday.

headline.seo: Militants Attack Kabul Airport and Afghan Capital
headline.main: Afghan Insurgency Attacks Kabul Airport and Building in Capital
headline.print_headline: Bombers Hit Afghans At Airport And Offices
